column4: hiya all, Ijust installed ubuntu-netbook-extensions into my normal 9.10 setup and I don't like the way GNOME now comes up, but I can't seem to revert to the normal/standard X setup :(
what part of it don't you like?
also have you tried just uninstalling them again?
yes, I did try apt-get remove but it stayed the same.
this is on an Acer Aspire one pro (1024x600 display)
even tries remaking the user account
well isn't it just a special launcher on the desktop, and windows being maximalised?
I think so, though the desktop also lacks the normal main menu
so, even if I kill the launcher in the startup, when it gets in I can't then launch anything
dont you normally have main menu on the gnome panel? or can't you normally add it?
and the maximalising is done by "maximus" process
normally I would expect it to be available, though for some reason it's not there.   Any ideas how to add it?
(the gnome main menu to the top taskbar)
well, my husband just told me dinner is on the table, so I better move along, thanks for your help thus far Tartaros .
